body_content.explanation: a word used in some parts of the UK and Ireland to refer to an ant (= a small insect that lives under the ground in large, well-organized groups):
examples: Not one perished, not even an emmet.

body_content.explanation: a word used in Cornwall in southwestern England to mean a tourist (= someone who visits a place for pleasure, especially on holiday), or someone who moves to live in Cornwall from somewhere else:
examples: This route will be crawling with emmets during the summer months.
The proposed "emmet" tax would be ploughed into building new homes for people who are Cornish born and bred.
